message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a novel graph-based neural model for sentence ordering, which involves capturing global dependencies among sentences regardless of their input order. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) sub-category of Computer Science (cs.CL). Additionally, the model uses graph recurrent networks, which are a type of neural network commonly used in NLP tasks. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also focuses on learning semantic representations of sentences, which is a common theme in machine learning and deep learning research, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible sub-category. The use of entities to make more expressive graph representations is a unique aspect of the proposed model, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) or cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
